verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Repeat the second and fourth lines for each verse I left home when I was fifteen Oh mother now pray for me Me and Old Tom took to the sea On the good ship Pelican's Wing

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: The days were long but the nights were warm And we sailed through the winds of the summer storms

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: First we made for the shores of France With a load of silk and a girl who danced

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Then we made for the English land We were there three days, then we sailed again

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: She was a swift-sailed trader with a merry crew I liked each man and the captain too And when the work was done we would laugh and sing On the good ship Pelican's Wing

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: We were six days out of Bristol town When Davy spied a sail that was bearing down

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: The captain said "Oh lads, I fear We've come across the flag of a privateer."

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: So we raised our mains and we made to run We were a peace-time trader and we had few guns

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: But though we flew over the ocean wave The other ship caught us in just one day

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: They came at us with dawn's first light And we readied ourselves and we made to fight

verse.name: v10
verse.lines: Old Tom died with steel in his hand And my other friends followed, nigh to the man

verse.name: v11
verse.lines: But they left me here upon this rock With a piece of bread wrapped in old sailcloth

verse.name: v12
verse.lines: But they left me no water for the heat of the day And I could hear them laughing as they sailed away
